title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ORLANDO – On a night where defense and offensive struggle defined the game for 48 minutes, Shaquille O’Neal authored a singular, seismic performance that defied the very logic of basketball.

In a grinding 95-84 victory for the Orlando Magic over the Portland Trail Blazers, O’Neal was an unstoppable force of nature. His final line was one for the ages: a colossal 46 points, a monstrous 21 rebounds, and 4 blocked shots. He did not merely lead his team; he carried them, accounting for nearly half of Orlando’s total points against a physical Portland defense that had no answer for his dominance.

The game itself was a rock fight, with both teams shooting below 41 percent from the field. But while others faltered, O’Neal thrived. Every entry pass into the post was an imminent crisis for the Trail Blazers, who watched helplessly as he powered through double-teams and finished with thunderous authority. His 21 rebounds, including 8 on the offensive glass, ensured that every Orlando miss was a potential second chance for another O’Neal masterpiece.

Portland’s efforts, led by Clifford Robinson’s 18 points and 10 rebounds, were ultimately swallowed whole by the Shaq-sized vortex in the paint. The Magic’s supporting cast provided just enough, with Anfernee Hardaway’s 15 points serving as a crucial supplement to the main event.

But this night belonged to one man. In an era of defensive battles, Shaquille O’Neal’s 46-point, 21-rebound tour de force was a historic declaration of individual power, a performance so grand it rendered the final score a mere footnote to his brilliance.
